titleInfo.title: 'Durbar on board R.I.M.S. Argonaut,Shergah.' Photographer: Unknown

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:204 x 284 mmCondition:The print is in good condition, though the mounting paper is heavily foxed and crumbling.Foliation:‘7’Process:Silver gelatin

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:View of a durbar on board the R.I.M.S. Argonaut, while the vessel was anchored off Sharajah. Lord Curzon and his staff are seated on a raised platform at the end of the deck, before an audience of European and Arab officials. The deck is covered with a canopy of flags, with ornate textiles covering almost every visible surface. The Shaikhs are seated at left and centre and face the dais.An account of the durbar can be found in: John Gordon Lorimer, ‘Appendix P: Cruise of His Excellency Lord Curzon, Viceroy and Governor-General of India, in the Persian Gulf’ in Gazetteer of the Persian Gulf, 'Omān, and Central Arabia, Vol. I Historical Part II, (Calcutta: Superintendent Government Printing, India, 1915), pp. 2637–2639Inscriptions:Ink, below image: 'Durbar on board R.I.M.S. Argonaut, Shergah.'
